questions.question_text:
Near the end of a sprint, the IT systems were taken down for a critical patch, and the team was inactive for four hours. The team members are concerned they will not be able to complete their tasks before the end of the sprint.
Which of the following BEST describes how the Scrum master should assist the team to finish on time?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Add the uncompleted work to the product backlog.

In Scrum, the product backlog is a prioritized list of work that needs to be completed. If the team is unable to complete their tasks before the end of the sprint due to unforeseen circumstances, the Scrum master should work with the team to add the uncompleted work to the product backlog. This allows the team to prioritize the remaining work and determine how to best allocate their resources to complete it.

Adding the uncompleted work to the product backlog also allows the team to reassess the scope of the sprint and determine if it is still realistic given the unexpected downtime. The Scrum master may also need to work with the team to adjust the sprint plan to account for the lost time and ensure that the team is able to deliver a potentially shippable increment of work at the end of the sprint.

questions.question_text:
Top-level managers are considering joining certain projects, programs, and operations to be managed as a group.
Which of the following is being considered?

A project team decides to obtain a support contact on one of the hardware infrastructures being used on the project. This is to ensure the project is grounded if an issue with the hardware occurs during the course of the project.
This type of risk response is known as:
questions.answer_description:
You'll use several strategies when determining both negative risks and opportunities and formulating your response plans. The strategies to deal with negative risks include the following:
✑ Avoid: Avoiding the risk altogether or eliminating the cause of the risk event
✑ Transfer: Moving the liability for the risk to a third party by purchasing insurance, performance bonds, and so on
✑ Mitigate: Reducing the impact or the probability of the risk
✑ Accept: Choosing to accept the consequences of the risk
